bold.description: Use for headers on 'color.elevation.surface' or 'color.elevation.surface.overlay'.

plain.description: Use for body copy and menu items on 'color.elevation.surface' or 'color.elevation.surface.overlay'.

subtle.description: Use for labels and subheadings on 'color.elevation.surface' or 'color.elevation.surface.overlay'.

muted.description: Use for placeholders and hints on 'color.elevation.surface' or 'color.elevation.surface.overlay'.

inverted.description: Use for text on bold backgrounds.

disabled.description: Use for text in a disabled state on 'color.background.disabled.muted' and 'color.background.disabled.subtle'.

selected.description: Use for text in selected states (e.g., tabs or menu items) on 'color.background.selected.subtle'.

brand.description: Use for non-interactive brand-reinforcing text on 'color.elevation.surface' and 'color.elevation.surface.overlay' backgrounds.

plain.description: Use for text that communicates informative messages the user needs to be aware of on neutral backgrounds, such as 'color.elevation.surface' and 'color.elevation.surface.overlay'.

bold.description: Use for text that communicates informative messages the user needs to be aware of on info backgrounds, such as 'color.background.info.subtle' and 'color.background.info.muted'.

plain.description: Use for text that communicates a favorable outcome on neutral backgrounds, such as 'color.elevation.surface' and, 'color.elevation.surface.overlay'

bolder.description: Use for text that communicates a favorable outcome on positive backgrounds, such as 'color.background.positive.subtle', and 'color.background.positive.muted'.

plain.description: Use for text that communicates caution to prevent mistakes or errors on neutral backgrounds, such as 'color.elevation.surface', and 'color.elevation.surface.overlay'.

bold.description: Use for text that communicates caution to prevent mistakes or errors on muted and subtle caution backgrounds, such as 'color.background.caution.subtle', and 'color.background.caution.muted'.

inverted.description: Use for text that communicates caution to prevent mistakes or errors on the bold caution backgrounds 'color.background.caution.bold'.

plain.description: Use for text that communicates negative or serious error states (e.g., validation errors or irreversible actions) on neutral backgrounds, such as 'color.elevation.surface', and 'color.elevation.surface.overlay'.

bold.description: Use for text that communicates negative or serious error states (e.g., validation errors or irreversible actions) on negative backgrounds, such as 'color.background.negative.subtle', and 'color.background.negative.muted'.

plain.description: Use for blue text on neutral backgrounds, such as 'color.elevation.surface' or 'color.elevation.surface.overlay', for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

bold.description: Use for blue text on muted and subtle blue backgrounds, such as 'color.background.accent.blue.muted' or 'color.background.accent.blue.subtle', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

plain.description: Use for green text on neutral backgrounds, such as 'color.elevation.surface' or 'color.elevation.surface.overlay', for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

bold.description: Use for green text on muted and subtle green backgrounds, such as 'color.background.accent.green.muted' or 'color.background.accent.green.subtle', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

bold.description: A neutral border option that passes min 3:1 contrast ratios.

inverted.description: Use for borders on bold backgrounds.

disabled.description: Use for borders of elements in a disabled state.

focused.description: Use for focus rings of elements in a focus state.

selected.description: Use for borders that emphasize selected states, such as tabs or menu items.

input.description: Use for borders of form UI elements, such as text fields, checkboxes and, radio buttons.

negative.description: Use for borders that highlight negative or serious error states, such as validation errors or irreversible actions.

plain.description: Use for screen overlay that appears with dialogs or drawers.
Use for skeleton loading states.

subtle.description: Use for the pulse or shimmer effect in skeleton loading states.

idle.description: The default, flat surface level. Used for primary content backgrounds or non-interactive UI regions.

hover.description: The default, flat surface level in hover state. Used for primary content backgrounds.

active.description: Use as the default background for the UI while pressing.

idle.description: Background of elevated components like cards, grids, or dropdowns that sit on top of the base surface. Use in combination with 'elevation.shadow.raised'.

hover.description: Background of elevated components in hovered state like cards, grids, or dropdowns that sit on top of the base surface. Use in combination with 'elevation.shadow.raised'.

active.description: Background of elevated components in active state like cards, grids, or dropdowns that sit on top of the base surface. Use in combination with 'elevation.shadow.raised'.

idle.description: An alternate surface color used for visual differentiation in components like tables or lists, providing contrast between consecutive items (e.g., zebra striping).

hover.description: An alternate surface color in hover state used for visual differentiation in components like tables or lists, providing contrast between consecutive items (e.g., zebra striping).

active.description: An alternate surface color in active state used for visual differentiation in components like tables or lists, providing contrast between consecutive items (e.g., zebra striping).

sunken.description: A secondary background used across the UI for grouping related items or applying zebra striping within grids, enhancing visual distinction between rows or sections.

idle.description: Background of elevated components like cards, grids, or dropdowns that sit on top of the base surface. Use in combination with 'elevation.shadow.raised'.

hover.description: Background of elevated components in hovered state like cards, grids, or dropdowns that sit on top of the base surface. Use in combination with 'elevation.shadow.raised'.

active.description: Background of elevated components in active state like cards, grids, or dropdowns that sit on top of the base surface. Use in combination with 'elevation.shadow.raised'.

idle.description: An alternate surface color used for visual differentiation in components like tables or lists, providing contrast between consecutive items (e.g., zebra striping).

hover.description: An alternate surface color in hover state used for visual differentiation in components like tables or lists, providing contrast between consecutive items (e.g., zebra striping).

active.description: An alternate surface color in active state used for visual differentiation in components like tables or lists, providing contrast between consecutive items (e.g., zebra striping).

overflow.description: Use to create a shadow when the content scrolls under other content.

overlay.description: Use for the box shadow of elements that sit on top of the UI, such as dialogs, cards, menus and drawers.
